intro: Circaea lutetiana f. pseudocordata, commonly known as the false heartleaf woodruff, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are typically heart-shaped, though the variety pseudocordata exhibits slightly modified leaf morphology compared to the typical form. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within its native range.
